column3: The phone on his desk rang, startling him. It was nine twenty-five. He hadn't realized he had been sitting as if in a fugue.
9:25 p.m. Aargh. Suddenly main menu is on TV saying "Press 6." Oh dear. Realize was using telly remote control by mistake. Now news has come on.

This is the table on which Tom Tear will work if ever he becomes an architect. At that moment the table was horizontal and there was a clock on it, and an electric lamp which didnâ€™t work, and a burning candle, and a radio with a plastic cabinet in which another clock was inlaid. Both clocks said twenty-five past nine.
